snippet: The widow of Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian nationalist leader who mysteriously died in 2004, is calling for an inquest after a report by Al Jazeera that said he might have been poisoned.
abstract: Suha Arafat, widow of Yasir Arafat, will seek permission to exhume his remains for an inquest following a report by Al Jazeera that he may have been poisoned with a rare radioactive isotope; Arafat, the father figure of Palestinian nationalism, died mysteriously in 2004.
lead_paragraph: The widow of Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian nationalist leader who mysteriously died in 2004, is calling for an inquest after a report by Al Jazeera that said he might have been poisoned.

headline.main: Al Jazeera Says Arafat Might Have Been Poisoned
headline.print_headline: Al Jazeera Says Arafat Might Have Been Poisoned
